bug.short_desc: useDefaultTheming property to automatically use qooxdoo styles for fonts etc.

long_desc.thetext:
From ths thread on the mailing list:
http://www.nabble.com/HtmlEditor-qooxdoo-0.8.3-Theming-ts25336762.html
There are no CSS stylesheets at the moment. The default CSS values are hard coded at the HtmlArea. You can manipulate these default CSS values by handing in some additional CSS rules, but the ultimate goal should be the HtmlEditor content looks exactly the same as an qx.ui.embed.Html widget that displays the same HTML content. There is a way of achieving this (see list thread), but it would be better if HtmlArea offers a property in the future like e.g. "useDefaultTheming" so that the application developer only has to set the property and the HtmlArea would get its values (e.g. for fonts, colors etc.) from the current theme.
Move HtmlArea with no milestone to framework
Discontinued support for htmlarea in the framework, set all open issues to WONTFIX. Still available as a contribution acc. to bug #7918 .
